reviews.text: I was here three nights staying on the ground floor in a double. It's true it can be a bit noisy if you leave the window to the courtyard open, but I had no problem sleeping, both with it open and closed. The rOoms are sufficiently large with great shower pressure, but mine did smell a bit musty. To me, the patio made up for everything!! It's a sunny, beautiful place to read or hang out when not enjoying Sucre from the outside...the room is just a safe place to sleep as far as I am concerned!
reviews.title: Beautiful courtyard area, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very grand, colonial style hotel with two lovely courtyards. A good sized room with plenty of space, large writing desk, bed side table, luggage rack and two beds. The room did get quite hot, especially in the evenings.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel

reviews.text: It's quite close to some church bells which can get quite noisy at certain times, it's also next to a girl's school and they were noisier than the bells! Therefore, I recommend some ear plugs. You might also want an eye mask as the curtains didn't block much light.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was clean and fresh with a good shower.
reviews.title: Not the best but ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For once they seem to understand the needs of the modern traveller, with plenty of electrical sockets around the room for recharging laptops and cameras etc. There were two free Internet terminals in the reception area, and they were a decent spec for a change.
reviews.title: Terrible hotel - stay somewhere else!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Independencia for two nights in May 2008 and really loved it. The hotel is an elegant old building around a courtyard and is just round the corner from the main square. The room was small but comfortable, and had the hottest, most powerful shower I´ve had in 3 months travelling in South America (it's worth staying there just for that!). Breakfast is also very good, with an excellent selection of fruit and main dishes. There are two free internet terminals at reception. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel right at the heart of the city

likes.liked: — Hot showers, central location, good food

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a tour traveling through south America. The location is excellent, as you are less then a block from the main square. We had access to activity vendors, shopping and decent restaurants/bars just minutes from the hotel. Wifi is intermittent within the hotel, but still available which was nice. they also have two computers in the lobby that worked better then some other places I tried in SA.
reviews.title: Great Location, Charming Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is decent and clean, by NA standards I would say it's a 3 star level over all, but very charming.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel with colonial charm

reviews.text: Staff was nice, continental breakfast was decent, and I got a fairly good sleep as we were at the back of the courtyard away from the street.
reviews.title: Relaxing - love the atmosphere & ambience

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and we loved it here. The hotel is quite colonial in style and has 2 really lovely courtyards where you can sit outside and there is a really pretty fountain. The room we stayed in was really sizeable with a fridge and tv with lots of channels (English speaking).
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: The location was terrific and close to the main square and whilst this is a huge city, the hotel was really tucked away and there was no noise from the traffic and city folk.The window of the room was overlooking the courtyard and on one night there was some noise from people sitting outside but generally it was very peaceful here.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Most Enjoyable!
